reviewText: Please note this rating has nothing to do with the company who shipped this.  A 5 goes to the company who shipped this out to me, thanks again.As for the DVD itself as any Naruto it's excellent, but on a major downside extremely slow progressing. I was disappointed this volume was left on a cliff hanger.  As far as Naruto Shippuden goes, at least 3 volumes have to be sold together for a cheaper price.  Naruto going to the hot spring, Naruto eating food with friends, or silly arguments that cut down on the serious parts just waists so much time and makes it very annoying.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: Not bad of an anime, descent price for this set eight. Stays kind of close to the manga series here and there.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: Another fine story arc from this fine series. We need to show it more often on regular television but they took it off the air 2 years ago. Very sad but the DVD's have kept me going!
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: This is not some trolls rant, it is rather me just saying that after watching yet another unnecessary large filler it bothered me a little. Enough to look at where the anime is now in japan, and let me tell you, if you dislike filler, you better buckle up. Not only do they have more multi episode filler plots they seem to run out of ideas and bring back the one episode filler storys, alot of them. I loved this series so much cosplayed it and all. But seeing as how the anime keeps adding filler for no apparent reason, being as they are so far behind the manga I am done with naruto, throwing in the towel with disgust. There was once a time I looked forward to watching this series and seeing where it went, now i feel left with nothing but a empty bitterness for all shonen maybe when it ends if it ever ends I will watch, or rather read the last few chapters. But why bother we really know how this is going to end, it was the journey there that always interested me. Agien not a rant just a dissillousioned fan left wondering why I spent so much money on this series. Power to all you who keep on. 6 years was to long for me. Peace out and God bless.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: This was a great story! A lot of my favorite characters...Hinata, Shino,& Kakashi especially. Exciting and a lot of action. It was great to see them in action with team #7 and Naruto. It is Naruto that is a must see. The production quality is superb also. Get it! Forget the rap that it is filler, it is Naruto anime that you will love if you are a Naruto fan!
summary: Super box set...super anime story...who cares if it wasn't in the manga!
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: While I didn't usually mind the filler episode gaps the creators of the anime series did to not overreach the manga series chapters these episodes really didn't do anything at all but just annoy me as being a waste of time.  The short info of these episodes as far as I can see deal with Naruto and company trying to find a new lead on the whereabouts of the traitor scumbag Sasuke,  but during the journey the characters find a new hidden agenda that Orochimaru is concocting to further increase his power base by using a mysterious child with a unique ability to do it.  While we'll get to see some of the longtime missing members of Team 8 in action(Hinata,Kiba,Shino minus their teacher Kurenai) which is a treat the overall entertainment of the episodes is pretty bland.  I wouldn't mind getting the box set if it had the entire story-saga plot regardless of the blandness of some of the episodes but sadly it doesn't and were going to be stuck having to get another box set with the conclusion of this sub-plot saga which is more then a little annoying.  Also unlike with the Team Asuma/Hidan Kakuzu confrontation story the enemy in this story plot line feels somewhat sadly inept though possessing a unique jutsu ability still doesn't have the same flare as the two mentioned before though that is kind of expected.  So while for Naruto box set completest fans this set is an affordable price for their anime collection  I feel many like myself will see this story plotline as a one time watch and forget kind of set...
summary: Even For Those Of Us Naruto Episode Filler Likers This Was Not Needed
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: The box sets used to go on sale for $16-20... now they rarely get under $30... plus they practically halved the number of episodes per boxed set even though we are paying more money per each set.  Disappointed with both amazon and Viz.  Going to spend my money elsewhere.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: This set continues the story of Naruto trying to find a way to control his new power but a mysterious child with a unique ability gets in the way. This set contains 12 episodes and as always its top quality in picture and sound. Naruto fans this is a must buy!
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight

reviewText: My son loves Naruto and being able to purchase this as a set was wonderful. He has enjoyed every minute of each episode. Also, by purchasing them I have freed up space on our DVR.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Eight
